thread.title: Forget the Bad Reviews; Donna Summer Musical Is Doing Well on Broadway

author: Charles Passy
title: Forget the Bad Reviews; Donna Summer Musical Is Doing Well on Broadway
text:
Never mind the negative reviews. “Summer,” the Donna Summer musical that opened on Broadway this past week, is proving itself hot stuff at the box office.
The show grossed slightly above $1 million for the seven-day period ended Sunday, according to the Broadway League, the trade group that tracks the industry. That put it ahead of several other shows, including such long-running musicals as “Anastasia,” “Beautiful,” “A Bronx Tale,” “Chicago,” “Kinky Boots,” “The Phantom of the Opera,” “School of Rock” and “Waitress.”
